CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 21, 1958, pg. A2, reads: "Cephus Presides - J. Cephus Ford, with sledge hammer in hand, president of the Checker Club, presides at the annual opening of the club safe, Dec. 12, for its yield of pennies for the NAACP and the Crippled Children's Fund. Present at the opening ceremonies were, left to right: Mrs. Marion Jordon and the Rev. Charles H. Foggie, executive secretary and president of the local NAACP, respectively; Mr. Ford, and Edward Shelton, staff assistant of the Pittsburgh NAACP. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Marion Bond Jordon, Rev. Charles Foggie, J. Cephus Ford holding hammer over opened safe, and Edward Shelton, gathered for Checker Club annual charity for NAACP and Crippled Children's Fund
